repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: snippet newline use before line indent after expand.

Solution: it should level + 1.

comment_data.body: This is just adding noise with noticeable benefit.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,13 +1,14 @@
 local G = vim.lsp._snippet_grammar
-local snippet_group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('vim/snippet', {})
-local snippet_ns = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace('vim/snippet')
+local api = vim.api

comment_data.body: This should be a separate test, with its own description.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -230,14 +231,20 @@ describe('vim.snippet', function()
   end)
 
   it('updates snippet state when built-in completion menu is visible', function()
-    test_expand_success({ '$1 = function($2)\n$3\nend' }, { ' = function()', '', 'end' })
+    local curbuf = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+    api.nvim_set_option_value('sw', 2, { buf = curbuf })

comment_data.body: onelese table lookup . it's somewhat trivial.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,13 +1,14 @@
 local G = vim.lsp._snippet_grammar
-local snippet_group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('vim/snippet', {})
-local snippet_ns = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace('vim/snippet')
+local api = vim.api

comment_data.body: I just feel this case is enough. But there is no harm in adding a newline of tabs and spaces. but note still need these settings in this case.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -230,14 +231,20 @@ describe('vim.snippet', function()
   end)
 
   it('updates snippet state when built-in completion menu is visible', function()
-    test_expand_success({ '$1 = function($2)\n$3\nend' }, { ' = function()', '', 'end' })
+    local curbuf = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+    api.nvim_set_option_value('sw', 2, { buf = curbuf })

comment_data.body: The point is about being explicit _what_ each test is testing. Testing multiple things at the same time means failures will be harder to interpret.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -230,14 +231,20 @@ describe('vim.snippet', function()
   end)
 
   it('updates snippet state when built-in completion menu is visible', function()
-    test_expand_success({ '$1 = function($2)\n$3\nend' }, { ' = function()', '', 'end' })
+    local curbuf = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+    api.nvim_set_option_value('sw', 2, { buf = curbuf })

comment_data.body:
Yes, it's trivial, and the table lookup is not a bottleneck in this code (unless benchmarks say otherwise).

And now I have to wade through a long diff to find the ones that make the _actual_ change described in the PR.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,13 +1,14 @@
 local G = vim.lsp._snippet_grammar
-local snippet_group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('vim/snippet', {})
-local snippet_ns = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace('vim/snippet')
+local api = vim.api

comment_data.body: yup fair enough .
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,13 +1,14 @@
 local G = vim.lsp._snippet_grammar
-local snippet_group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('vim/snippet', {})
-local snippet_ns = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace('vim/snippet')
+local api = vim.api

comment_data.body: emm seems like my test case is missing, stash restore my case lol i will readd it.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -230,14 +231,20 @@ describe('vim.snippet', function()
   end)
 
   it('updates snippet state when built-in completion menu is visible', function()
-    test_expand_success({ '$1 = function($2)\n$3\nend' }, { ' = function()', '', 'end' })
+    local curbuf = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+    api.nvim_set_option_value('sw', 2, { buf = curbuf })

comment_data.body:
Nit, but I prefer to keep the full-variable-name convention in this file:
```suggestion
    local shiftwidth = vim.fn.shiftwidth()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -446,14 +446,18 @@ function M.expand(input)
       base_indent = base_indent .. (snippet_lines[#snippet_lines]:match('(^%s*)%S') or '') --- @type string
     end
 
+    local sw = vim.fn.shiftwidth()

comment_data.body: Why use `vim.fn.shiftwidth` here and not `vim.bo[curbuf].shiftwidth` (as we do for `expandtab`)?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -446,14 +446,18 @@ function M.expand(input)
       base_indent = base_indent .. (snippet_lines[#snippet_lines]:match('(^%s*)%S') or '') --- @type string
     end
 
+    local sw = vim.fn.shiftwidth()

comment_data.body:
Look at the signature of `test_expand_success`. You can pass a settings parameter instead of setting the options like this.
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/e1af3817958a2b9a818fcb10eec9f1197bd62dfd/test/functional/lua/snippet_spec.lua#L71
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -230,14 +231,29 @@ describe('vim.snippet', function()
   end)
 
   it('updates snippet state when built-in completion menu is visible', function()
-    test_expand_success({ '$1 = function($2)\n$3\nend' }, { ' = function()', '', 'end' })
+    local curbuf = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+    api.nvim_set_option_value('sw', 2, { buf = curbuf })

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  it('correctly indents with newlines', function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -230,14 +231,29 @@ describe('vim.snippet', function()
   end)
 
   it('updates snippet state when built-in completion menu is visible', function()
-    test_expand_success({ '$1 = function($2)\n$3\nend' }, { ' = function()', '', 'end' })
+    local curbuf = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+    api.nvim_set_option_value('sw', 2, { buf = curbuf })
+    api.nvim_set_option_value('expandtab', true, { buf = curbuf })
+    test_expand_success({ '$1 = function($2)\n$3\nend' }, { ' = function()', '  ', 'end' })
     -- Show the completion menu.
     feed('<C-n>')
     -- Make sure no item is selected.
     feed('<C-p>')
     -- Jump forward (the 2nd tabstop).
     exec_lua('vim.snippet.jump(1)')
     feed('foo')
-    eq({ ' = function(foo)', '', 'end' }, buf_lines(0))
+    eq({ ' = function(foo)', '  ', 'end' }, buf_lines(0))
+  end)
+
+  it('correct indent with newline', function()

comment_data.body: Why are you modifying this test? These are _unit tests_ and each one should check a single functionality.
`vim.fn.shiftwidth` also handles if `expandtab` is not enabled
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -446,14 +446,18 @@ function M.expand(input)
       base_indent = base_indent .. (snippet_lines[#snippet_lines]:match('(^%s*)%S') or '') --- @type string
     end
 
+    local sw = vim.fn.shiftwidth()

comment_data.body: so it will use `tabstop` or `shiftwidth` depending on the input
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -446,14 +446,18 @@ function M.expand(input)
       base_indent = base_indent .. (snippet_lines[#snippet_lines]:match('(^%s*)%S') or '') --- @type string
     end
 
+    local sw = vim.fn.shiftwidth()

comment_data.body: because the snippet in this case also have newline

Most of them do, but this specific test should just check that the built-in completion doesn't affect snippet navigation. Adding extra settings and checks will make investigating any future test failures harder, since the unit test is verifying multiple things.
i had remove the newline in this case because we do have a single it for newlines so no need change here
oh right. i saw it :)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -230,14 +231,29 @@ describe('vim.snippet', function()
   end)
 
   it('updates snippet state when built-in completion menu is visible', function()
-    test_expand_success({ '$1 = function($2)\n$3\nend' }, { ' = function()', '', 'end' })
+    local curbuf = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+    api.nvim_set_option_value('sw', 2, { buf = curbuf })

comment_data.body: I still don't think there's need to modify this test :)
Is newline important in this case? This is irrelevant if you just want to verify what happens when pum is visible. Otherwise, either add appropriate indent settings or modify newline's expect

But _real life_ snippets have new lines. This was a regression test added when fixing https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/25895, and I used the same example that echasnovski used.

I just find it odd to change this test when the bugfix is unrelated to it. The test is passing, and checks a specific behaviour independent from this PR.

comment_regular_data.body: Please don't make unrelated changes in a commit; it makes it harder to review. (If you want to include these changes here, at least put them in a separate `refactor` commit.)

title: fix(snippet): correct indent with newline
